lexUnit.name: sleeve.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the part of a garment that wholly or partly covers a person's arm.

sentence.text: At a friend 's studio she posed , head on one side and delicate long fingers hanging languidly from the enveloping sleeves of her home-made gown .
The man was perhaps in his sixties , the empty right-hand sleeve of his jacket pinned to his side .
Ma is trying to apologise for it with her eyes as she sucks khaki splodges from the sleeve of her cardigan .
He rose then as if to go but impulsively Robyn caught at the sleeve of his robe .
She grabbed Steve 's sleeve , their eyes in unison watched the ball sail through the air and high over the net .
Smallfry was smiling sweetly as she reached for Frankie 's sleeve and eased him in the direction of the door .
I did n't mind a bit when it ran down my wrist and into my sleeve .
He wiped the inside of the helmet with his anorak sleeve and put the helmet down beside him .
Her fingers clutched at the light material of his jacket sleeve as though imploring him to listen .
He shot it straight out of his jumpsuit sleeve , through the skin and bones of his human hand and right at Rex 's throat .
The mare was indicating that she did , standing companionably in the darkening stable , lipping at his anorak sleeve .
He was still holding the coat sleeve .
He cut the sleeve on my leather jacket .
An easy , t-shape voile blouse with short sleeves and an unusual horizontal pleat detail .
She reached out for him again , and his arms felt lean and hard through the sleeves of his tunic .
Paige watched the movement in terrible fascination , watching the play of muscles in his tanned arms beneath the rolled-up sleeves of his shirt .
Suragai tucked his hands into the sleeves of his surcoat .
Unless it was pouring with rain he wore no hat or coat , his shirt sleeves rolled up to the elbow and wearing a green baize apron .
He was in his shirt sleeves staring through the side window at me .
Having exhausted the tissues , she wiped her nose on her sleeve .
Claire pulled at his sleeve .
I would wear extra layers of clothing and pull the sleeves of my sweater down to hide my white , numbed fingers .
She had put an old cardigan over the top , and she 'd rolled up the sleeves and she was shaking that bucket .
Nenna had rolled up her sleeves in the warmth of the snug , showing round forearms covered with very line golden hair .
` Do n't you ever put me through that situation again , " she snarled through clenched teeth , tugging irritably at the sleeve of her mink jacket .
` Mister , " he said , tugging at Tom 's coat sleeve .
There 's something fishy up your sleeve .
Candy sat back , stroking down the sleeve of her green velvet top .
It reminded him of shop stewards with their sleeves rolled up in those endless conferences when it was said that the country was being held to ransom .
The blouse has short dolman sleeves , a fly front fastening and a mock pocket flap on the left breast .
